intro: Ophryosporus heptanthus, commonly known as the seven-lobed bladderpod, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its distinctive pinnately compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that are inflated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, often found in dry, disturbed soils. The species is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to arid environments.
